title: How to keep positive attitude ?
body: well i have recently got back into playing league more often and i still cant escape the unskilled/troll  teammates with childish ranting ,trolling ,pointless racist remarks also the  blame game. i admit i have done my fair share of ranting after been bashed with trolls endlessly and feel like playing less and less. I am wondering if anyone else has similar problems and how does one keep them self from not having a negative attitude after constant B.S from some teammates. it feels like a uphill battle to try and not want to rant or just quit in middle of games sometimes and i am finding myself starting to want to play less and less. What happen to playing a simple game to have fun and being competitive at same time but still be mature enough to make it fun for all ?

replies.body: Admit your mistakes and don't fight your team. Try to avoid spreading the fire.

i do admit my mistake and  even apologies if i am out of line my problem is how other constantly kills your game vibe and make you not  want to play and make you lose your positive attitude but you still try to see some what hope for next team but then there is that one person that just ruins it
Welcome to life. Where hope can be crushed easily and all you can do is move forward.

The only answer that will ensure you don't lose your account is this:

Any time you are being hardcore trolled, just accept the fact that you lost your game  due to one player and mute them. There isn't anything you can do about it in game. If they for some reason decided to queue up just to ruin the experience for the 4 people unfortunate enough to get put on a team with them, there is nothing you can do about it. These games will happen, more often than some will admit, but you just need to accept that fact when you play League and hope that it balances out eventually.

If I am in a good mood i will just talk positive no matter what they say, if i am not in a good mood I will listen to music and ignore any comment that isnt positive. I will say Gj and Ty to anyone who does anything good, regardless of how toxic they are. If someone is being toxic to you don't say anything or say something like "oops" or "mb im sorry" when you make a mistake. Most of the time the other non-toxic people will stick up for you if you show you are aware you are making mistakes.  
  
Once played a game where this Jinx spent the first 23 minutes of the game bashing me non-stop because I didn't back with her at level 2 and we lost a bit of pressure because i didn't have pots anymore... I said "Lol" to everything she said, then during a teamfight she healed me right before i died and i was able to escape so I said "Gj Jinx and ty for saving me, nice heal" they responded with "Np bro, anytime" and the toxicity stopped for the rest of the game :D  

Basically just ignore negative comments, if you can't /mute all

I like to think as analytically and as non-personally as possible.  Even if something goes horrible, don't worry about what people say about it.  If you really want to get better, you should really try to think a lot about what really happened and what really should be done in order to make it correct so you can do it a better way in the future.  You shouldn't even listen to them as they let their emotions take over too easily and likely blame the wrong thing, and if you do listen to them, it will prevent you from learning what the real problem was and prevent you from advancing your play.  As long as you always take the understand it all approach you shouldn't get too negative.

Me personally, I see no problem leaving a game if you already have an afk especially if you're so far behind. There's no reason to make yourself suffer any longer. Just leave, do something to relax yourself for 30min or so and try and try again.

Also for some reason, Normals has the saltiest people in the game. More so than ranked for some reason.

Firstly, forget about playing ranked altogether. You'll experience a more positive environment in normals, where winning means less and having fun means more.

Secondly, get used to muting your entire team and the entire enemy team every single game. I do this now, and it's incredible how less irritable I am after games. I don't wait for them to start being toxic, I take the initiative and mute them all immediately. That way I never see a single negative remark in the chat, and I can concentrate on my gameplay.

Thirdly, play only champions you enjoy playing. Ignore what the team "needs", ignore people who tell you to play certain things, and ignore everything people say about X champion being bad/useless. By playing only champions you like, there's less risk around stressing out over playing something you're uncomfortable with.

Lastly, listen to some chill music as you play. This may seem incredibly cliche, if not downright useless, but you'd be surprised at the effect music has on the human brain. Pop on some tunes you love, and all the negativity will be replaced by positive thoughts, and it will create a relaxing atmosphere perfect for enjoying the game.
